refnamediv.refpurpose: check invariants and use these to simplify or eliminate summands of an LPE

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The &lpeinvelm; tool checks whether the invariant in internal mCRL2 format as found in &invariant; holds for the mCRL2 LPE as found in &infile;. If the invariant holds, it will eliminate all summand of the LPE of which the condition violates the invariant. It can also be used to simplify the conditions of the summands of the given LPE. The resulting LPE is written to the file named &outfile;.
If &infile; is not specified, the LPE is read from &stdin;. If &outfile; is not specified, the resulting LPE is written to &stdout;.

Given an LPE,
P(d: D) = ... + sum ei: Ei. ci(d, ei) -> ai(fi(d, ei)) . P(gi(d, ei)) + ...;
a formula of the form
inv(d) /\ ci(d, ei) => inv(gi(d, ei))
is generated for each of the summands, where inv() is the formula passed using the option &opt_invariant;. This formula is an invariant of the LPE if it holds in the initial state and all the generated formulas are tautologies.

The invariant is used to eliminate summands as follows. A formula of the form
inv(d) /\ ci(d, ei)
is generated for each of the summands or for the summand indicated using the option &opt_summand; only. The tool uses a BDD based prover for propositional formulas to see if the generated formula is a contradiction. If the formula is a contradiction for some summand, this summand will be eliminated from the LPE. If the formula is not a contradiction, the summand remains unchanged unless the option &opt_simplify_all; is used.

The option &opt_simplify_all; will replace the conditions of all summands by the equivalent BDD of the condition in conjunction with the invariant passed using the option &opt_invariant;. This may enable other tools, like for instance &lpeconstelm; or &lpeparelm;, to simplify the LPE even further.

In some cases it may be useful to use an SMT solver to assist the prover. The SMT solver can further reduce BDDs by removing inconsistent paths. A specific SMT solver can be chosen using the option &opt_smt_solver;=&solver;. Either the SMT solver &solver_ario; or &solver_cvc_lite; can be used. To use one of these solvers, the directory containing the corresponding executable must be in the path. On June the 20th of 2006, Ario was available on &link_ario; and CVC Lite was available on &link_cvc;.

Without using the option &opt_no_check;, &lpeinvelm; will first check if the given formula is an invariant of the LPE. If this is not the case, no elimination or simplification will be done. In some cases the invariant may hold even though the prover is unable to determine this fact. In cases where a formula is an invariant of the LPE, but the prover is unable to determine this, the option &opt_no_check; can be used to eliminate or simplify summands anyway. Note that this also makes it possible to eliminate or simplify summands using a formula that is not an invariant of the LPE.

The option &opt_verbose; gives insight into what the prover is doing and can be used to see if rewrite rules have to be added to the specification, in order to enable the prover to determine the invariance of a formula.
